results.title: The Mystery single vehicle crash
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.
Although many drivers involved in single vehicle crashes attribute the cause of their accidents to mechanical failures of the car, very often it was the driver and not the car who was to blame. This film stresses that while mechanical checks of one’s car most important, it is even more vital that the driver is in good physical and mental condition before taking to the road.

results.title: The Head on collision
results.creator_credit: Commonwealth Department of Transport, Film Australia and Telemark Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.
Made for the Department of Transport, this film shows distractions both inside and outside the car, tiredness, “highway hypnosis”, and alcohol - as the major causes of head-on collisions. Explains how these can be avoided. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Freeway driving
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.
Emphasises the particular skills needed for safe use of freeways where road speed is greater than normal and driving dkills are different.

results.title: The Cross road crash
results.creator_credit: Commonwealth Department of Transport, Film Australia and Telemark Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.
Indicates that crossroads are one of the most likely places to have a collision. Lists the type of crossroads and discusses the avoidance of situations leading to accidents. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Car behind
results.creator_credit: Commonwealth Department of Transport, Film Australia and Telemark Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.
Advises on the precautions to be taken when driving in front of another vehicle, including procedures for overtaking, increasing the distance between cars, and the use of brake lights, traffic indicators, and hand signals. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Commonwealth Department of Transport, Film Australia and Telemark Productions
results.description:

description_for_label:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.

results.title: The Car ahead
results.creator_credit: Commonwealth Department of Transport, Film Australia and Telemark Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.
Demonstrates the reaction time between a signal to brake and the application of the brake by the driver. Advises on precautions to be taken when following another vehicle. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Secretary and Her Boss
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

group_works.title: Try to see it my way (NP)

results.title: We can work it out (NP)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Secretary and Her Boss”.
Secretary (Adrienne Posta) and her boss (John Cleese) try to resolve the problems presented in the unsatisfactory manner in which they both handle visitors, telephone calls and dictation.
FOR USE ONLY IN A DOMESTIC SITUATION OR FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.
